subNodes.conversationText: root
There you are, <FirstName>. Your sister told me of your plans. Please tell me it is not true.
Mother, you should be in bed. You are in no condition to be walking around.
I wish you wouldn't leave, I can't lose another child.
Ian is fine, I'm sure of it. Just get some rest mother. Jaden, take care of mother, I'll be back soon.
I understand, everything will be fine mother. <FirstName> will be safe and <he/she> will find Ian and bring him back home.
continue
Please be safe. I can't bare to lose you now that your brother and your father have not returned.
I'll return mother, I promise.
May Elos be with you.
End Dialog
Don't worry, mother.  I'll take a couple of friends with me and we'll find Ian.
May Elos be with you.
I can't stay here. I keep thinking that if I don't leave now, it may be too late. I could never live with myself if I didn't try.
I understand, everything will be fine mother. <FirstName> will be safe and <he/she> will find Ian and bring him back home.
Sixty years have passed since the Great Battle for Charn.
continue
The followers of Zorn grew in numbers and began to hunt down all the people of Charn who remained in the area.
continue
Many were lost, but a number escaped through the Great Mountains and settled in the Eastern lands.
continue
Your father and a large group journeyed back to Charn, but were never heard from again. That was ten years ago.
continue
Recently, your older brother and a small group left in search of clues to your father's where abouts or demise. It has been a month and no word.
continue
You have decided to take a small group of two or three in search of your brother. Hopefully the small group size will go undetected by the recently growing threat of Zorn's minions.
continue
There you are, <FirstName>. Your sister told me of your plans. Please tell me it is not true.
Mother, you should be in bed. You are in no condition to be walking around.
I wish you wouldn't leave, I can't lose another child.

continue

May Elos be with you.

May Elos be with you.
I can't stay here. I keep thinking that if I don't leave now, it may be too late. I could never live with myself if I didn't try.
I understand, everything will be fine mother. <FirstName> will be safe and <he/she> will find Ian and bring him back home.
